America, the election is almost here. Here‚Äôs what to expect when polls close:

The margins are going to be close, but our campaign is on track to win this election. Americans all across the country are casting their votes in record numbers, ready to turn the page.

It will take time to count every vote, and there may be swings in the count along the way. Donald Trump falsely claimed victory in 2020, and we expect that he will do it again. We know that he is a liar‚Äîbut the ballots will tell the truth. Stay patient, and know that every vote will be counted fairly. 

America‚Äôs election system is strong‚Äîand it will not be interfered with by partisan actors. Our legal operation is ready to fight to protect every vote and make sure every last one is counted. Your vote is your voice, so get out and make yours heard: IWillVote.com.

Together, we are going to win this election, and chart a new way forward.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I love this country with all my heart.

And I believe in its promise‚Äîbecause I‚Äôve lived it.

I grew up as a child of the Civil Rights Movement. My parents would take me to marches when I was a toddler, where crowds of people of all races, faiths, and walks of life came together for freedom and opportunity.

I‚Äôve lived the promise of America.

I saw how hard my mother worked to give her daughters the same chances this country gave her. I was blessed to have family by blood and family by love who instilled in me the values of community, compassion, and faith that have always defined our nation at our best.

I‚Äôve lived the promise of America. 

I‚Äôve spent my life fighting for people who have been overlooked, but who still believe that in this country, we should all be equal in the eyes of the law.

I‚Äôve lived the promise of America‚Äîand I see the promise of America in all of you.

In the young people voting for the first time, who are determined to live free from gun violence, protect our planet, and shape the world they inherit. In the women who refuse to accept a future without reproductive freedom and the men who support them. In Republicans who have never voted for a Democrat before but put the Constitution of the United States over party.

In Americans, different in many respects, but united by love of freedom, a belief in fairness and decency, and faith in a better future. 

That is why I‚Äôm in this race, America.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
When I was in high school, I started to notice something about my best friend, Wanda. She was sad at school, and there were times when she didn‚Äôt want to go home. 

One day, I asked Wanda if everything was all right, and she confided in me that she was being sexually abused by her stepfather. I immediately told her she had to come live with us. I called my mother, and my mother said, ‚ÄúOf course she does.‚Äù

And so Wanda did.  

Wanda‚Äôs story is one of the reasons I wanted to become a prosecutor. As a courtroom prosecutor, I felt a deep sense of responsibility to take on crimes and harms against women and children. When I had a case, I charged it not in the name of the victim but in the name of the people for one simple reason: In our system of justice, a harm against any one of us is a harm against all of us.

Through all my decades in law enforcement, I never asked a victim or a witness, ‚ÄúAre you a Republican or a Democrat?‚Äù The only question I ever asked was, ‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù That is the kind of president we deserve, and that is the kind of president I pledge to be.

As president, I will fight to protect our fundamental freedoms and make sure everyone has a right to safety, dignity, and justice.

Our Harris-Walz administration will cut red tape and work with the private sector to build 3 million new homes and provide first-time home buyers with $25,000 down-payment assistance‚Äîso you can get your foot in the door and have the opportunity to own a home, like my mother was able to.

I have fought for the people for my entire career. 

As a young courtroom prosecutor in Oakland, I stood up for women and children against predators who abused them.

As district attorney of San Francisco, I helped make California the first state to ban the ‚Äúgay/trans panic‚Äù defense, which was often used to justify horrendous violence against the LGBTQ+ community.

As attorney general of California, I took on the big banks and delivered $20 billion for middle-class families facing foreclosure. I stood up for veterans and students being scammed by big for-profit colleges, for workers who were being cheated out of the wages they were due, and for seniors facing elder abuse.

As U.S. Senator for California and Vice President of the United States, I have fought on behalf of all Americans‚Äîand I will continue to do so as president. 

Together, we will build a brighter future for our nation.

As president, I will fight for all Americans, and together, we will build a brighter future for our nation.

name: Kamala Harris

In 1776, General George Washington crossed the icy Delaware River in darkness, achieving a major victory in the American Revolution. Not too far from that very location, delegates from across the nation gathered to compose the Constitution of the United States.

Our nation‚Äôs founders often disagreed, but as they wrote our Constitution, they laid out the foundation of our democracy, including the rule of law, checks and balances, free and fair elections, and a peaceful transfer of power. These principles and traditions have sustained our nation for over two centuries. Americans from all backgrounds and beliefs have cherished, upheld, and defended them. 

Yesterday, I proudly stood in that same place in Washington Crossing, Pennsylvania, with over 100 Republican leaders from across our nation who are supporting my candidacy for President of the United States. Those who formerly worked with Presidents George W. Bush, George H.W. Bush, and Ronald Reagan, as well as Mitt Romney, John McCain, and even members of Donald Trump‚Äôs own administration. 

We may not agree on everything. But we share a core belief that our democratic ideals are at stake in this election‚Äîideals that our founders and generations of Americans before us have fought for. Now, the baton is in our hands. I am grateful to each person who has decided to put our country before party.

This November, with your help, we will write the next great chapter in the most extraordinary story ever told.

Growing up in a small town, you learn to take care of your neighbors. So let me tell you exactly what @KamalaHarris and I will do to support our rural communities.

With our Plan for Rural America:

We‚Äôll recruit 10,000 more rural health care professionals and increase access to affordable and high-quality health care in rural communities.

We‚Äôll make sure independent pharmacies can stay open ‚Äî and build 3,000 more, so rural communities can get the medications they need.

We‚Äôll support the sandwich generation to care for our elders at home and lower the cost of child care.

We‚Äôll support family farmers and help ensure future generations of American farmers can thrive by helping beginning farmers get more access to credit, and connecting them with all sorts of training and technical assistance.

And we‚Äôll make sure farmland remains farmland and isn‚Äôt taken over by big corporate buyers.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
As president, I will create an opportunity economy that taps into the ambitions and aspirations of the American people.

It will empower Black families to achieve homeownership and build intergenerational wealth‚Äîand it will benefit our country as a whole.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
My parents met while protesting for civil rights. When I was a child, they would take me to marches in a stroller.

Those were my first memories of seeing people fighting for the freedoms and the promise of America that had long been kept from them.

As I have traveled across the country, I have spoken with many Americans‚Äîincluding Black men‚Äîabout their hopes, dreams, hurdles, and worries. Black men and boys deserve a president who sees them, and will help break through the barriers preventing them from building intergenerational wealth and realizing their aspirations.

Donald Trump is not that president.

Trump‚Äôs business career began when he was investigated for refusing to rent property to Black families. His entry into public life was when he took out a full-page ad in the New York Times calling for the execution of the Central Park Five‚Äîinnocent Black teenagers who were later exonerated. As president, he called majority-Black nations ‚Äúshitholes.‚Äù

Today, Trump‚Äôs Project 2025 agenda would give him unchecked power, posing an even more serious threat to Black communities. He would bring back stop-and-frisk, roll back civil and voting rights, and implement a national sales tax costing families an average of $4,000 per year.

We can‚Äôt go back‚Äîand we do not have to. Today, I‚Äôm announcing an Opportunity Agenda for Black Men.

It will, among other things, provide 1 million fully forgivable loans to entrepreneurs, and protect cryptocurrency investments so people who make them know their money is safe. It will launch a National Health Equity Initiative focused on illnesses that disproportionately impact Black men like sickle cell disease and diabetes. And it will legalize recreational marijuana and ensure that all Americans have opportunities to succeed as this new industry takes shape.

When we invest in Black men‚Äîtheir dreams, aspirations, and ambitions‚Äîwe are stronger.

The story of Dreamers is a story of America. Dreamers are our neighbors, our friends, and our coworkers. DACA has been a lifeline for young people to live without fear and lawfully work in the only country they‚Äôve ever called home: the United States of America. 

But today, their future is on the line once again as Donald Trump‚Äôs allies continue to make every effort to terminate DACA. Donald Trump tried to end DACA once, and if given the chance, he will not rest until he is successful. That would mean hardworking families ripped apart, businesses suddenly without employees, and communities thrown into needless chaos. It‚Äôs un-American and wrong. 

I will always stand with Dreamers and keep families together. As attorney general of California, as a U.S. senator, and as vice president, I fought to defend and protect DACA. And as president, I will ensure we live up to our values by fighting to protect Dreamers and urging Congress to pass an earned pathway to citizenship for these young people.

We will continue to do everything we can to protect the people who are in the path of this storm. name: Kamala Harris

I took care of my mother when she was sick with cancer‚ÄîI know that caregiving is about dignity.

My plan will allow Medicare to cover in-home health care, which will lower costs and reduce the financial and emotional stress for families across the country.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
My mother was diagnosed with cancer when I was the district attorney of San Francisco. I remember cooking meals for her and taking her to her appointments. I did what I could to make her comfortable. I figured out which clothes were soft enough that they wouldn't irritate her, and told her stories to try and make her laugh. 

Caregiving is about dignity‚Äînot just for the patient, but also for the caregiver. We must lower the costs and ease the burdens faced by our caregivers to make it easier for them to provide care, while pursuing their aspirations.

Today, I am announcing a new historic Medicare at Home benefit as part of my plan to help families with caregiving needs and strengthen Medicare for the long-term. Over 67 million people are covered by Medicare, yet many Americans don‚Äôt realize that Medicare does not cover long-term services and assistance like home health aides. 

As a result, many American families face challenging and sometimes impossible choices. 

My plan will strengthen Medicare to cover home care services and support for seniors. This will include providing care workers with better wages, improving the quality of care for seniors and those with disabilities, and treating our seniors with the dignity they deserve.

name: Kamala Harris
text: I am proposing a plan that will allow Medicare to cover in-home health care.

Clean water should be a right for everyone, not just the people who can afford it.

As president, I will work with communities like those in Flint, Michigan to ensure they not only have clean water, but the opportunity to recover economically and thrive.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
FEMA has already shipped over 11.5 million meals and 12.6 million liters of water to aid response efforts in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene. We have over 5,600 federal personnel on the ground.

This week, @POTUS also directed the Department of Defense to move up to 1,000 soldiers to support the delivery of food, water, and other essentials to impacted communities as quickly as possible.

Our nation is grateful for their dedication and service.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
Donald Trump makes big promises, but always fails to deliver.

He said he was the only one who could bring back America‚Äôs manufacturing jobs. Then, America lost nearly 200,000 manufacturing jobs‚Äîand those losses started before the pandemic.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
We need to build more housing in America. 

We will cut the red tape and work with the private sector to build 3 million new homes, and we‚Äôll provide first-time homebuyers $25,000 in down payment assistance so they can get their foot in the door.

As president, I will continue fighting to make health care more affordable for middle class families.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
As we tackle the climate crisis, we will lower household energy costs, create hundreds of thousands of high-quality clean energy jobs, and build a thriving clean energy economy. 

@Tim_Walz and I will always fight for the freedom to breathe clean air, drink clean water, and live free from the pollution that fuels the climate crisis.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
On January 6, Donald Trump incited an attack on our nation‚Äôs democracy because he didn‚Äôt like the outcome of the election. Armed with weapons and animated by Trump‚Äôs lies, insurrectionists invaded the United States Capitol in an attempt to overturn a lawful election.

The January 6 Committee exemplified a bipartisan effort to safeguard our democracy and preserve our most sacred freedoms for generations to come‚Äîled by Republicans like @Liz_Cheney and @AdamKinzinger, who chose to put country over party‚Äîalongside Democrats. 

The oath to uphold the Constitution of the United States is sacred and must always be upheld‚Äînever violated. The most fundamental question in this election is: Who will obey that oath?

I have sworn that oath to uphold the Constitution six times throughout my career‚Äînot only as Vice President or as a U.S. Senator, but also as the top law enforcement officer of the largest state in our country. I have never wavered in upholding that oath, and I have always executed it faithfully and without reservation.

Therein lies the profound difference between Donald Trump and me.

Anyone who, like Donald Trump, violates that oath‚Äîwho recklessly tramples on our democratic values, who actively tries to overturn the will of the American people, or who has called for the ‚Äútermination‚Äù of the Constitution‚Äîmust never again stand behind the seal of the President of the United States.

The vast majority of us agree that upholding the Constitution must be a basic requirement we expect of anyone seeking the highest office in the land. Regardless of our political party, we believe that we must hold sacred America‚Äôs fundamental principles‚Äîfrom the rule of law to the peaceful transfer of power. 

If you stand for country, democracy, and the rule of law‚Äîour campaign has a place for you.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I have sworn an oath to uphold the Constitution six times in my career, and have always upheld it without reservation. 

Therein lies the profound difference between Donald Trump and me. He violated that oath, and, make no mistake: if given the chance, he would violate it again.

name: Kamala Harris
text: Country over party.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
My opportunity economy plan offers:

name: Kamala Harris
text:

That is money she could use to:
‚ÄîPay off student loans
‚ÄîPut a down payment on a house
‚ÄîStart a small business

name: Kamala Harris

The vast majority of us agree: We must hold sacred America's fundamental principles. If you share that view‚Äîno matter your political party‚Äîthere is a place for you in this campaign.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
The burden of these natural disasters on local and state governments has been immense. 

Yesterday in Georgia, we announced that the federal government will reimburse 100% of local costs to get relief to those impacted as quickly as possible.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
To the people of Georgia and all those across the southeast who have been affected by this devastating storm: President Biden and I are here for the long haul.

Today, @POTUS approved the full federal reimbursement of costs, which allows relief to get to communities as quickly as possible and helps with emergency services people desperately need.

name: Kamala Harris
text: Thank you to all those who are doing critical work in Georgia and throughout the region to get folks the support and the relief that they so desperately need, and so rightly deserve, in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
Over the past few days, communities in the southeast have endured destruction and devastation.

While in Augusta, Georgia today, I spoke with people impacted by Hurricane Helene. I also received briefings from those who are working around the clock to help folks on the ground. We will continue to do everything we can to help communities recover.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I just landed in Georgia where I will meet with families impacted by Hurricane Helene, as well as the first responders, volunteers, and state and local officials who are helping provide relief.

Our nation stands with all those who have been affected by this storm.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
The Trump-Vance Project 2025 agenda is a direct attack on our freedoms and our nation‚Äôs future. 

@Tim_Walz and I, along with our people-powered campaign, will defeat their dangerous agenda at the ballot box.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
More than 1 in 3 women lives in a state with a Trump Abortion Ban. Many of these states have bans that include no exceptions for rape or incest.

That is immoral.

When Congress passes a bill to restore reproductive freedom, as president, I will proudly sign it into law.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
To the dedicated first responders, state and local officials, and federal personnel who are working around the clock in the wake of Hurricane Helene: Thank you.

Thank you for all you do to provide resources and support to those impacted. You represent the best of our nation.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
On January 6, the former president incited an attack on our nation's democracy because he didn't like the outcome of the election.

If you stand for country, democracy, and the rule of law‚Äîour campaign has a place for you.

text:
The Trump-Vance Project 2025 playbook would give Trump unprecedented and unchecked legal power to attack our fundamental rights, freedoms, and our democracy.

And as Coach Walz says, ‚ÄúIf somebody draws up a playbook, they plan on using it.‚Äù

@KamalaHarris will bring the bill back and sign it.

text: We are pro-women. We are pro-freedom to make your own choice.

Donald Trump did what he promised and gave tax cuts to the wealthy. Now he‚Äôs proposing a 20% sales tax on everything our country brings in.

Everyone agrees ‚Äì including businesses ‚Äì that it would be destabilizing, increase inflation, and potentially lead to a recession.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I don't talk about my faith a lot, but Matthew 25:40 says: "To the least among you, you do of me."

That's what the bipartisan border bill does. It's supported by law enforcement and lets us keep our dignity about how we treat people.

The people closest to Donald Trump have said he's unfit for the highest office.

text: If you‚Äôre getting squeezed by the price of prescription drugs, Kamala Harris and I are going to take on Big Pharma ‚Äì extending the $35 cap on insulin and $2,000 cap on out-of-pocket costs to all Americans, not just seniors.

text:
Donald Trump and JD Vance will restrict our most fundamental freedoms: the freedom to vote, to make decisions about our own bodies, to love who we love openly and with pride.

@Tim_Walz and I agree: The government should not be dictating how we live our lives. We believe in freedom.

text:
We have capped the cost of insulin and the cost of prescription drugs for seniors. When I am president, we will continue to make health care more affordable.

Donald Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúconcepts of a plan‚Äù would gut health care for millions of Americans without a plan to replace it.

In coordination with state and local officials, President Biden and I will continue to make sure that communities have the support and the resources that they need not only to respond to this storm and its immediate aftermath, but also the resources they will need to recover.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
Good-paying jobs should be available to all Americans‚Äînot just those with college degrees. 

As President, I will eliminate unnecessary degree requirements for federal jobs.

name: Kamala Harris
text: Donald Trump was handed $400 million on a silver platter and then filed for bankruptcy six times.

name: Kamala Harris
text: As president, I will secure our border, disrupt the flow of fentanyl coming into the United States, and work to fix our broken system of immigration.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
This week, I was in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to discuss how we will strengthen our economy and chart a new way forward. There‚Äôs an old saying that the best way to predict the future is to invent it. That is the story of the Steel City. A city that helped build the middle class, birth America‚Äôs labor movement, and empower the rise of American manufacturing and innovation. 

We have an extraordinary opportunity at this moment. An opportunity to make our middle class the engine of America's prosperity; to build a stronger economy where everyone, everywhere, has a chance to pursue their dreams and aspirations; and for the United States of America to continue to out-innovate and out-compete the world. 

That is why I created our Opportunity Economy Agenda. It would increase the tax deduction for startups by ten times to $50,000‚Äîbecause no one can start a business on $5,000. We have set an ambitious goal of 25 million new small business applications by the end of the first term, and we will strengthen our small businesses owners and entrepreneurs, the backbone of America‚Äôs economy. 

We will also invest in the industries like the ones that made Pittsburgh the Steel City. We will offer tax credits to strengthen factory towns‚Äîretooling existing factories, hiring locally, and adding good union jobs‚Äîbecause no one who grows up in America's greatest industrial or agricultural centers should be abandoned. We will also invest in emerging technologies to make sure America, and not China, are at the forefront of innovation. 

The proud heritage of Pittsburgh reveals the character of our nation: A nation that harnesses the ambitions, dreams, and aspirations of our people‚Äîand seizes the opportunities before us. That is what we have always done. And that is what we must now do.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
We're in the final sprint to Election Day, and we need all hands on deck to get @KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz  elected. Monday marks the campaign's last quarterly deadline, and anything you chip in makes a huge impact.

Let's win this, together. bit.ly/SupportKamala

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I was attorney general of a border state. Stopping transnational criminal organizations and strengthening our border is not new to me. 

I have done that work, and as president, and I will continue to treat it as a priority.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
For every story we hear of women suffering under Trump Abortion Bans, there are so many more untold.

To those women, I say: You are not alone. We see you, and we are here with you.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
Donald Trump made the challenges at the border worse, and he is still fanning the flames of fear and division‚Äîall for his political gain.

In this election there is a clear choice between common sense solutions and the same old political games.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
The American economy is the most powerful force of innovation and wealth creation in human history. 

Together, we will lower costs, invest in American innovation and entrepreneurship, and lead the world in the industries of the future.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
President Biden and I continue to work with local leaders in the southeast to provide support as they face the impacts of¬†Hurricane Helene¬†and begin to recover. More than 1,500 federal personnel have been deployed, including power restoration and search and¬†rescue teams.

Listen to local officials and stay safe. We are with you every step of the way.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
I reject the false choice that we must decide between securing our border and creating a system of immigration that is safe, orderly, and humane. 

We can and we must do both.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
As Attorney General of California, I prosecuted transnational criminal organizations that trafficked guns, drugs, and human beings. I know the importance of safety and security, especially at our border.

Today, I visited the U.S.-Mexico border and spoke with Customs and Border Protection officials about our progress to secure our border and disrupt the flow of illegal fentanyl into our nation.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
As attorney general of a border state, I prosecuted transnational criminal organizations that traffic guns, drugs and human beings.

Stopping transnational criminal organizations and strengthening our border is not new to me‚Äîand will continue to be a priority when I am president.

name: Kamala Harris
text:
The American people deserve a President who cares more about border security than playing political games. 

As president, I will bring back up the border security bill that Donald Trump sabotaged, and I will proudly sign it into law.

name: Joe Biden
text:
My grandfather Ambrose Finnegan used to say, "If you're lucky enough to be Irish, you're lucky enough."

Happy St. Patrick's Day!

name: Joe Biden
text: Alan Simpson was one of the finest Senators I ever served with. I got to the Senate in 1973; he got there in 1979. From the moment we met, we¬†were friends.¬†I served with many women and men during my time there, and there was no one I trusted more than Alan.¬†Though we didn't agree on everything, he was a man¬†of enormous decency and integrity, toughness and humor. When Alan said something, he meant it. Whatever he told you he would do, he did. He was the real deal.¬†One of the great honors I had as President was awarding Alan the Presidential Medal of Freedom.¬†If anyone deserved that award, it was him.¬†He will be remembered for bringing people together, leading with conviction, and I believe exemplifying what it means to be a public servant. He also had an enormous love and devotion to his family. Simply put: He was an incredible person.¬†I¬†send my love and condolences to his wife Ann,¬†their children Bill, Colin and Sue,¬†and the entire Simpson family. May he rest in peace.

name: Joe Biden
text: Jill and I are saddened by the passing of Congressman¬†Ra√∫l Grijalva. He will be remembered for tirelessly standing up for working families and protecting our environment. Our prayers are with his family and loved ones.

name: Joe Biden
text: Like so many of you, I'm celebrating the incredible women in my life today. International Women's Day is a time to recognize the achievements of women and girls everywhere and recommit our efforts to advance dignity, opportunity, and equality for all. When women and girls succeed, communities, economies, and democracies succeed.

name: Joe Biden
text:
60 years ago, hundreds of brave heroes marched unflinchingly across the Edmund Pettus Bridge, demanding the fundamental right to vote.¬†They were met with brutal force and violence, but their courageous activism continued until the Voting Rights Act became the law of the land.

Today, we honor those leaders by remembering the journey our Nation has taken ‚Äî and more importantly, where we must go now. Together, let's keep the faith.

name: Joe Biden
text: Sylvester Turner dedicated his career to serving the community he loved. He was a remarkable Congressman, Mayor, father, and grandfather. Jill and I are saddened¬†by his passing and send our deepest condolences to Sylvester's family and his beloved Houston community.

name: Joe Biden
text: Reunited with the best of the best on my favorite line. Thanks for the ride, @Amtrak.

name: Joe Biden
text:
As¬†Black¬†History¬†Month¬†comes to an end, we continue to celebrate the incredible contributions of¬†Black Americans to our country.¬†Black¬†history¬†is American history. Black¬†culture is American culture. And¬†Black stories and triumphs are at the core of who we are as a Nation.

As we reflect on where we have been, may we also recognize that our only way forward is by marching together.

name: Joe Biden
text: Jill and I are relieved, alongside millions of others around the world, that Sagui Dekel-Chen is finally reunited with his family after 498 painful days. I am proud that the deal we negotiated has held, paving the way for the release of hostages. My thoughts and prayers are with the remaining hostages and their families who have all been through hell. We hope all will be reunited in the weeks ahead.

name: Joe Biden
text: Happy Valentine's Day, Jilly!

name: Joe Biden
text: Great meeting today with the new Chair of the DNC, @KenMartin73 who is ready for the fight ahead.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I join Americans, Israelis, and people around the world in welcoming home Keith Siegel, an American held hostage by Hamas for 484 days, as part of the ceasefire deal my team and I negotiated. I look forward to the remaining hostages, including additional Americans, being reunited with their families soon.

I can only imagine the relief and joy that Keith‚Äôs family must be feeling today.¬†For more than a year, my team and I met with his family, including his wife Aviva who was once a hostage herself. I was continuously inspired by their strength and resilience as they did everything in their power to ensure he was not forgotten. My thoughts and prayers are with them and with all the families of the hostages today, all of whom have suffered so much.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Just got off a call with Ken Martin to congratulate him¬†on his victory.

I know he‚Äôll help ensure Democrats continue to fight for working people and¬†stand up to the abuse of power.¬†Together, we will¬†choose possibility over peril and empower more Americans to believe that the America of our dreams is closer than we think.¬†

We just have to keep the faith and spread it.

name: Joe Biden
text: Jill and I are praying for the families of the victims who tragically lost their lives in the plane and helicopter crash near DCA.¬†We are immensely grateful to the brave first responders and emergency personnel on the scene.

name: Joe Biden
text: It‚Äôs our responsibility to stand up to antisemitism and give hate no safe harbor.¬†#HolocaustRemembranceDay

name: Joe Biden
text: It has been the honor of our lifetimes to serve you, the American people.

name: Joe Biden
text:
When I look back on the past four years, I don‚Äôt just see the challenges we faced.
¬†
I see hope, progress, and possibility.
¬†
A picture is worth a thousand words, but these photos tell the story of an America that‚Äôs always moving forward ‚Äì we must keep it going.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today I'm affirming what I have long believed and what three-fourths of the states have ratified:
 
The 28th Amendment is the law of the land, guaranteeing all Americans equal rights and protections under the law regardless of their sex.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, I'm commuting the sentences of nearly 2,500 people convicted of non-violent drug offenses.

This is an important step toward righting historic wrongs and providing deserving individuals the opportunity to return to their communities after far too much time behind bars.

name: Joe Biden
text:
It‚Äôs been the privilege of my life to serve our nation for over 50 years.

I‚Äôve given my heart and soul to you, and I‚Äôve been blessed a million times in return with the love and support of the American people.

Join me as I deliver my farewell address. nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1MYxNMoqR‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, after many months of intensive diplomacy by the United States, along with Egypt and Qatar, Israel and Hamas have reached a ceasefire and hostage deal.
 
My diplomacy never ceased in their efforts to get this done ‚Äì I will speak more about this soon.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Since Kamala and I took office, our nation has become stronger at home and in the world.

America today is more capable and prepared than we have been for a long time.

While competitors are facing stiff headwinds, we have the wind at our back.

This is what we're handing over.

name: Joe Biden
text:
When Roe v. Wade was overturned, we committed that we'd never stop fighting for your reproductive rights.
 
Republican elected officials made it clear they will not protect the rights of women.
 
So we did.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today I convened the @VP and key response officials from my team for a virtual briefing on the Administration's efforts to suppress the wildfires across Los Angeles.

We will continue supporting the state and local response with federal resources, for as long as it takes.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I've convened the @VP and Senior White House and Administration officials for a briefing on the full federal response to the wildfires across Los Angeles.
 
Tune in here: nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1OyJAZVNM‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
To the brave men and women who ran towards danger over the past 24 hours in Southern California, I want you to know your President, and the rest of the country, is with you.

You suited up and risked your lives to save the lives of your fellow Americans. We are indebted to you.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Over 100,000 people have been ordered to evacuate communities impacted by the Southern California wildfires. At least two people have been killed. And many more are injured ‚Äì including firefighters.

It‚Äôs devastating.

To the residents of Southern California: We are with you.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I have directed the @DeptofDefense to rapidly provide additional firefighting personnel and capabilities to the region being impacted by the Southern California wildfires.

We also continue to work closely with the National Guard.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Jill and I traveled to New Orleans to stand with a community defined by strength and resilience.
 
To grieve.
To pray.
And let them know that America stands with them, and mourns with them.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Four years ago, violent insurrectionists attacked the Capitol, threatened the lives of elected officials, and assaulted brave law enforcement officers.

We cannot forget.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Judges matter. They shape the everyday lives of Americans, preserving our freedoms and defending our liberties.

The 235 judges confirmed by my administration include a record number with backgrounds that have long been overlooked: advocates for civil rights, workers‚Äô rights, immigrants‚Äô rights, and more.

I appointed the first former public defenders to sit on several different circuit courts, while also putting forward men and women who have pursued justice as prosecutors.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I am proud to have secured a historic 235 judicial confirmations during my administration. 

These judges will be independent, fair, and impartial‚Äîrespecting the rule of law and upholding the Constitution.

name: Joe Biden
text: As the 119th Congress convenes today, I‚Äôm reflecting on my time in the Senate with a few throwbacks.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Folks, it's 2025. That means Medicare‚Äôs new $2,000 cap on prescription drug costs from my Inflation Reduction Act goes fully into effect.

This is a game changer.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I have been continually briefed since early¬†this morning regarding the horrific incident that occurred in New Orleans overnight.

The FBI is taking the lead in the investigation and is investigating this incident as an act of terrorism. I will continue to receive updates throughout the day, and I will have more to say as we¬†have further information to share.

My heart goes out to the victims and their families who were simply trying to celebrate the holiday. There is no justification for violence of any kind, and we will not tolerate any attack on any of our nation's communities.

name: Joe Biden
text: Happy New Year, folks.

name: Joe Biden
text: Happy New Year, America!

name: Joe Biden
text:
Over six decades, Jill and I had the honor of calling Jimmy Carter a dear friend. 
 
But, what‚Äôs extraordinary about Jimmy Carter, though, is that millions of people throughout America and the world who never met him thought of him as a dear friend as well.

name: Joe Biden
text: Today, America and the world lost an extraordinary leader, statesman and humanitarian.

name: Joe Biden
text: Getting to show up for the American people every day is the best part of my job. Here‚Äôs a look back at this past year.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I‚Äôve always said that every new small business is an act of hope. 

That‚Äôs 20 million acts of hope by the American people.

name: Joe Biden
text: Jill and I wish all those celebrating a very happy Kwanzaa‚Äîone blessed with peace, hope, and light.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Hanukkah is a timeless story of miracles. 

Jill and I wish you and your loved ones a happy Hanukkah!

name: Joe Biden
text: Merry Christmas, everyone!

name: Joe Biden
text:
Jill and I hold a special place in our hearts for the brave men and women in uniform who defend our nation, many of whom are away from their families this holiday season.

Wishing you and your loved ones a safe Christmas Eve.

name: Joe Biden
text:
This holiday season, Jill and I are thinking of the brave first responders and frontline workers who keep our communities and families safe.

Our nation is stronger because of them.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I am commuting the sentences of 37 individuals on federal death row to life sentences without the possibility of parole.

This action is consistent with my Administration's moratorium on federal executions, except for cases involving terrorism and hate-motivated mass murder.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Tax cuts for the wealthy didn‚Äôt create opportunities for workers and families. Instead, factory towns were hollowed out, and fewer Americans ended up better off.

That‚Äôs why I fought to invest in jobs of the future, lower costs, raise wages, and strengthen workers and small businesses.

We put working families and the middle class at the center of all of my economic policies.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The 55,000 public servants approved for debt cancellation today are workers who have dedicated their lives to giving back to their communities.

Now, they are finally earning the relief they are entitled to under the law.

name: Joe Biden
text: Thanks to my Inflation Reduction Act, we‚Äôve made historic progress lowering health care costs: $35 for insulin, $35 for inhalers, a $2,000-a-year cap on prescription drugs for Medicare recipients, and more.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, I'm building on my Administration's historic climate record by setting an ambitious new goal to cut greenhouse gas emissions by more than 60% by 2035.

We're the United States. Together, I know we can do this.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, families in Madison, Wisconsin are grieving the loss of those who were killed and wounded at Abundant Life Christian School.

It‚Äôs shocking and unconscionable.

We need Congress to act. Now.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Social Security represents a rock-solid promise.

For nearly 90 years, it‚Äôs been a guarantee that has allowed generations of American seniors to retire with the dignity and peace of mind they've earned.

I'm proud to have kept, protected, and strengthened that promise my entire career.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I am proud of the work we have done to make the Affordable Care Act more accessible and more affordable for folks like Phoenix‚Äôs grandmother.

The deadline to enroll in coverage is January 15. Head to HealthCare.gov to sign up.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Twelve years ago, the soul of Newtown, the soul of Connecticut, and the soul of the nation were pierced forever when 26 lives were stolen at Sandy Hook Elementary School.

We owe a debt of gratitude to the courageous survivors, families, first responders, and Connecticut officials who turned their deep grief into action. Their years of advocacy made the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act possible.

name: Joe Biden
text:
When I took office, the pandemic was raging and the economy was reeling. 

From Day One, I was determined to not only deliver economic relief but to invest in America. 

We passed legislation to rebuild our infrastructure, build a clean energy economy, and bring manufacturing back to the United States after decades of offshoring.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Two years ago, I was proud to sign the Respect for Marriage Act into law‚Äîrequiring interracial and same-sex marriages to be recognized in every state in the nation.

It was a vital step towards creating a nation where decency, dignity, and love are honored and protected.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I pray to God that the president-elect throws away Project 2025. I think it would be an economic disaster.

I believe the only way for a president to lead America is to lead all of America.

name: Joe Biden
text: On my watch, we took on Big Pharma with the Inflation Reduction Act‚Äîand won.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, I‚Äôm pardoning 39 people with non-violent crimes who have demonstrated remorse and rehabilitation, and I‚Äôm commuting the sentences of nearly 1,500 others ‚Äì many of whom would have received lower sentences today.
¬†
America was built on second chances. That's what these pardons and commutations represent.

name: Joe Biden
text:
After decades of trickle-down economics, we've written a new playbook that's growing the economy from the middle out and the bottom up.

We‚Äôve helped create over 16 million new jobs, achieved historically low unemployment, and seen a record 20 million new business applications.

name: Joe Biden
text:
We have worked tirelessly to protect and build on the Affordable Care Act, and now more Americans have signed up for health care coverage through the ACA Marketplace than ever before.

I encourage everyone to enroll now at HealthCare.gov for coverage.

name: Joe Biden
text:
It has been the honor of a lifetime to usher in a new era of Tribal sovereignty and self-determination. 

A new era grounded in dignity and respect.

To every Tribal Leader who has offered their partnership: Thank you for always believing in the possibilities of our nations.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The economy created 227,000 jobs in November.
Unemployment has been the lowest on average of any administration in 50 years.

This has been a hard-fought recovery, but we are making progress for working families.

name: Joe Biden
text:
On National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day, we remember the service members and civilians who paid the ultimate sacrifice for our country.

Let us carry forward their mission of forging a better future for humankind‚Äîone of greater dignity, opportunity, and security for all.

name: Joe Biden
text: Since taking office, we‚Äôve helped create 16 million jobs‚Äîand our economy has grown more than during any other presidential term this century.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Africa‚Äôs success is and will be the world‚Äôs success.

The United States is all in on Africa‚Äôs future.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Happy Thanksgiving, America.

May we use this moment to take time from our busy lives and focus on what matters most:

Our families, our friends, our neighbors, and the fact that we‚Äôve been blessed to live in America, the greatest country on Earth.

name: Joe Biden
text:
We don't have to choose between the environment and the economy.
 
You can do both.
 
We've proven it.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today I issued an official proclamation to support the conservation of nature around the world. 
 
Because the fight to protect our planet is a fight for humanity.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I'm proud to be the first sitting U.S. President to visit the Amazon rainforest.

We must recommit to protecting our planet.
 
Our world's forests are one of the most powerful solutions we have to fight climate change.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I know a thing or two about the importance of a smooth commute when it comes to showing up for your loved ones.

So does Camille.

Now, $45 billion from my infrastructure law will go toward improving commutes all across America.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Since I came into office, I have signed more than 34 bipartisan laws to support our veterans and their families, caregivers, and survivors. 

As a nation, we have one truly sacred obligation: To prepare and equip those we send into harm‚Äôs way and to care for them and their families when they return home.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, we honor all our veterans who have defended and fought for our democracy.  

They prove that we are a nation that can meet darkness with light, no matter how high the cost or how heavy the burden.

May we all strive to be worthy of their sacrifices for us.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today, we honor generations of America's veterans ‚Äì patriots who have stood on the frontlines of freedom and kept the light of liberty shining bright around the world.

May we all strive to be worthy of their sacrifices for us.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Setbacks are unavoidable, but giving up is unforgivable. As my dad would say, we all get knocked down‚Äîbut the measure of our character is how quickly we get up.

A defeat does not mean we are defeated. The America of your dreams is calling for you to get back up.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Vice President @KamalaHarris ran an inspiring campaign that allowed everyone to see something I learned early on: She has a backbone like a ramrod and great character. True character.

She gave her whole heart and effort, and she and her entire team should be proud.

name: Joe Biden
text:
What America saw today was the Kamala Harris I know and deeply admire.

She‚Äôs been a tremendous partner and public servant full of integrity, courage, and character.

Under extraordinary circumstances, she stepped up and led a historic campaign that embodied what‚Äôs possible when guided by a strong moral compass and a clear vision for a nation that is more free, more just, and full of more opportunities for all Americans.

As I‚Äôve said before, selecting Kamala was the very first decision I made when I became the nominee for president in 2020. It was the best decision I made. Her story represents the best of America‚Äôs story.¬†And as she made clear today, I have no doubt that she‚Äôll continue writing that story.

She will continue the fight with purpose, determination, and joy. She will continue to be a champion for all Americans. Above all, she will continue to be a leader our children will look up to for generations to come as she puts her stamp on America‚Äôs future.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Folks, if you‚Äôre in line to vote, stay in line. 

Electing @KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz is that important. I mean it.

name: Joe Biden
text: If you encounter any issues while voting, contact the voter assistance hotline: (833) 336-8683.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Polls are still open, folks.

Don‚Äôt sit this election out. @KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz are ready to serve on Day One.

Confirm your polling place and go vote: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Go vote. 

Let‚Äôs make history by electing @KamalaHarris. 
IWillVote.com

name: Joe Biden
text:
Tomorrow is Election Day.

If you didn‚Äôt vote early, make sure you know where your polling place is for tomorrow: IWillVote.com.

I know @KamalaHarris can beat Donald Trump, but you have to vote.

name: Joe Biden
text: It‚Äôs a great day to grab a meal with a friend and find out where you can vote: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text: Made a few friends at the polls.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I voted early, and I hope you do too.

This is the most important election of our lifetimes. I know @KamalaHarris will do one hell of a job as our next president.

Make your plan to vote: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text: Earlier today I referred to the hateful rhetoric about Puerto Rico spewed by Trump's supporter at his Madison Square Garden rally as garbage‚Äîwhich is the only word I can think of to describe it. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable. That's all I meant to say. The comments at that rally don't reflect who we are as a nation.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Tune in as Vice President @KamalaHarris delivers her closing argument before Election Day.

For ASL feed, please tune in here: us06web.zoom.us/j/8613225475‚Ä¶ nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1MYGNMAyl‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
I was proud to cast my ballot for @KamalaHarris, @Tim_Walz, @lisabrochester, and Democrats up and down the ballot with a few first-time voters. 

Folks, there is too much on the line to sit this election out.

If you haven‚Äôt already, make a plan to vote: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text:
üö®Join us Tuesday, October 29 for our National Virtual Call to get out the EARLY VOTE!

Hear from keynote speaker, President @JoeBiden with @MariaTeresa as well as other special guests! Don‚Äôt miss out.

Register now: votolatino.org/earlyvoting

name: Joe Biden
text:
I‚Äôve had the great fortune of knowing @JoeBiden for over three decades. His unwavering commitment to Delaware and our nation has created a lasting legacy, and I am beyond honored to have his support.

From the bottom of my heart, thank you Mr. President.

name: Joe Biden
text:
.@KamalaHarris, Secretary @DebHaalandNM, and I have worked to include Indigenous voices from day one.

I am proud to have reestablished the White House Council on Native American Affairs, relaunched the White House Tribal Nations Summit, and taken steps to improve historic Tribal consultation.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Federal Indian Boarding School policy will always be a significant mark of shame on American history. 

While darkness can hide much, it erases nothing. 

As I said throughout my presidency, we must know the good, the bad, and the truth of who we are as a nation.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I am committed to working with Indigenous communities across the country to write a new and better chapter of our history. 

Yesterday, I formally apologized for the Federal Indian Boarding School policy. It is long overdue.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The Federal Indian Boarding School Era is one of the darkest chapters of American history. The trauma experienced in those institutions haunts our conscience to this very day.

Today, I'm in Arizona to issue a long overdue presidential apology for this era ‚Äì and speak to how my Administration has¬†worked to¬†invest¬†in Indian Country and our relationships with Tribal Nations, advance¬†Tribal sovereignty and self-determination,¬†respect¬†Native cultures, and¬†protect¬†Indigenous sacred sites.

On my watch, we'll remain committed to ushering in a new era between our government and nation-to-nation relationships ‚Äì one that is grounded in dignity and respect.

We must remember our full history, even when it's painful. That's what great nations do. And we are a great nation.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Happy birthday, @KamalaHarris!

I've been proud to have you by my side, and I know you will be a great president. 

On your birthday, I‚Äôm encouraging folks to make a plan to vote: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Every president has to cut their own path. 

@KamalaHarris‚Äô perspective on how to solve our country‚Äôs problems is fresh and new. Donald Trump‚Äôs perspective is old, failed, and thoroughly dishonest.

name: Joe Biden
text:
As difficult as these past days have been, we‚Äôve seen incredible courage from so many Americans coming together‚Äîfirst responders, friends, families, and neighbors looking out for one another.

To all the people impacted by Hurricanes Milton and Helene: We‚Äôve got your back.

name: Joe Biden
text:
To everyone impacted by Hurricane Milton: I urge you stay inside and off the roads.

Downed power lines, debris, and road washouts are creating dangerous conditions.

Help is on the way, but until it arrives, shelter in place until your local officials say it‚Äôs safe to go out.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Governor DeSantis and Mayor Castor ‚Äì if you need any additional resources as we prepare for Hurricane Milton to make landfall, you give me a call.

We‚Äôre here for you as long as it takes.

name: Joe Biden
text:
An American president should prioritize the safety and well-being of the American people.

The idea that Donald Trump would withhold aid from Americans to coddle Vladimir Putin serves as a stark reminder of the danger he poses if he wins a second term.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Once again, Donald Trump is a liar. 

He's the guy who redirected relief funds as president. We are moving heaven and earth to make sure that everyone affected by Hurricane Helene gets what they need.

name: Joe Biden
text:
You can‚Äôt only help those in need if they voted for you.

It‚Äôs the most basic part of being president, and this guy knows nothing about it.

name: Joe Biden
text:
To the men and women who answered the call and ran into danger in North Carolina, those who left who they love at home to help a community in need:

You're nothing short of heroes.

May God bless you all. And may you keep the faith.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Earlier, I took an aerial tour over Western North Carolina to survey the damage. What I saw was heartbreaking.

But back on the ground, we‚Äôre witnessing neighbors helping neighbors, volunteers and workers standing side-by-side, people leaning on each other.

That's America.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Trust me, I know what a good vice president looks like. Tonight‚Äôs debate made it clear my friend @Tim_Walz has what it takes.

Join me in getting the Harris-Walz team across the finish line:
secure.actblue.com/donate/so‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
Coach, I got your back tonight!

Tonight, America will see the strong, principled, and effective leader I‚Äôve known for years‚Äîand the contrast you and Kamala provide against the other team.

name: Joe Biden
text:
This morning, @VP and I convened our national security team to discuss Iranian plans to launch an imminent missile attack against Israel.

We discussed how the United States is prepared to help Israel defend against these attacks, and protect American personnel in the region.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Donald Trump is a liar. 

I‚Äôm working with governors and local officials to help those impacted by Hurricane Helene.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I have been briefed by my team regarding what federal law enforcement is investigating as a possible assassination attempt of former President Trump today. 

A suspect is in custody, and I commend the work of the Secret Service and their law enforcement partners for their vigilance and their efforts to keep the former President and those around him safe.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Let us honor those we lost on September 11th by renewing our faith in one another, recommitting to national unity, and remembering who we are:
 
We never forget. We are never afraid. We endure. We overcome.

We are the United States of America.

name: Joe Biden
text: America got to see tonight the leader I‚Äôve been proud to work alongside for three and a half years. Wasn‚Äôt even close. VP Harris proved she‚Äôs the best choice to lead our nation forward. We‚Äôre not going back.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I never thought I‚Äôd say this so many times about an American president, but Donald Trump is a liar.

He calls our country a failing nation.

Just look at the facts. He‚Äôs dead wrong.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Jill and I are mourning the deaths of those whose lives were cut short due to more senseless gun violence and thinking of all of the survivors whose lives are forever changed in Winder, Georgia.

Students across the country are learning how to duck and cover instead of how to read and write. We cannot continue to accept this as normal.

name: Joe Biden
text:
My dad taught me a job is about a lot more than a paycheck.

That‚Äôs why @KamalaHarris and I are so proud to have the greatest job creation record in any single term: Nearly 16 million jobs, including nearly 800,000 manufacturing jobs.

name: Joe Biden
text:
.@KamalaHarris believes as I do that unions are the spine of this economy. She will be a historic, pro-union president. 

Folks, we've got one more job to do together. Join us in this fight: go.kamalaharris.com/

name: Joe Biden
text: Donald Trump would rather cross a picket line than walk one.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Let me tell you something: @KamalaHarris and I are damn proud to have protected the pensions of over one million union workers and retirees when I signed the Butch Lewis Act.

Not only did we restore the full amount‚Äîwe got them their back pay as well.

name: Joe Biden
text:
A lot of politicians have trouble saying the word "union."

I'm not one of them‚Äîand neither is @KamalaHarris.

name: Joe Biden
text:
When unions do well, everybody does well.

I‚Äôm in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania with @KamalaHarris this Labor Day to talk about the stakes of this election for workers. Tune in. nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1ypKdpevA‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
Wall Street didn't build this country‚Äîthe middle class built this country. And unions built the middle class.

This Labor Day, we celebrate American workers and unions.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I've worked tirelessly to bring Hersh home, and Jill and I could not be more heartbroken by the news of his death.

It is tragic and reprehensible.

Hamas leaders will pay for these crimes. And we'll continue working towards a deal to secure the release of the remaining hostages.

name: Joe Biden
text:
A single district court in Texas ruled that my Administration‚Äôs work to keep families together has to stop.

That ruling is wrong.

Families should not be needlessly separated ‚Äì they should be able to stay together.

My Administration will not stop fighting for them.

name: Joe Biden
Joe Biden
text:
Jill and I just spoke to @KamalaHarris ‚Äî we can‚Äôt wait to watch her accept this historic nomination.  

Kamala and Tim will inspire a generation and lead us into the future.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I am proud to watch my partner Kamala Harris accept our nomination for president. She will be an outstanding president because she is fighting for our future.

Tune in for the last night of the Democratic National Convention.
 nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1rmGPojve‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
Tim Walz will be an exceptional vice president. He and Kamala Harris are fighting for Americans‚Äô freedoms and against Trump‚Äôs extreme agenda.

Tune in as we kick off the third day of the Democratic National Convention.
 nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1vAxROjwE‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
What‚Äôs better than one triple thick, black and white milkshake after a convention speech?

A second to share with a friend.

name: Joe Biden
text:
.@KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz have a bold vision for America‚Äôs future. I‚Äôve never been more optimistic about the future of our country.

Tune in as the second day of the Democratic National Convention begins.
 nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1MnGnDoNm‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
.@KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz understand that this nation must continue to be a place of possibilities‚Äînot just for a few of us, but for all of us.

Join me in promising your whole heart to this effort. That‚Äôs where my heart will be.
go.kamalaharris.com/

name: Joe Biden
text: I love you, America.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The vote each of us casts this year will determine whether democracy and freedom will prevail. It‚Äôs that simple‚Äîand that serious.

The power is in your hands. History is in your hands.

America‚Äôs future is in your hands.

name: Joe Biden
text:
In 2024 we need you to vote.

We need you to keep the Senate.

We need you to win back the House.

And above all else, we need you to beat Donald Trump.

name: Joe Biden
text:
MAGA Republicans found out the power of women in 2022.

And Donald Trump is going to find out the power of women in 2024.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Violent crime has dropped to its lowest level in more than 50 years.

And crime will keep coming down when we put a prosecutor in the Oval Office‚Äîinstead of a convicted felon.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Donald Trump promised infrastructure week every week for four years.

He never built a damn thing.

name: Joe Biden
Joe Biden
text:
Let me ask you: Are you ready to vote for freedom?

Are you ready to vote for democracy and for America?

And let me ask you: Are you ready to elect @KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz as president and vice president?

name: Joe Biden
text: I was proud to fulfill my promise to appoint the first Black woman to the Supreme Court.

name: Joe Biden
text:
I‚Äôm grateful @KamalaHarris cast the tie-breaking vote to pass the Inflation Reduction Act‚Äîlowering Bob‚Äôs insulin to $35 a month.

Not a single Republican helped us.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Because of the Affordable Care Act and the work we‚Äôve done, I was able to meet Phoenix‚Äôs grandmother.

I‚Äôm proud to have expanded and protected the Affordable Care Act to cover life-saving medicine for families like theirs.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Democracy prevailed in 2020. Over the last four years, we proved that democracy delivers. And with @KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz, democracy will be preserved.

Tune in as I speak at the first day of the Democratic National Convention.
 nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1LyGBgzjQ‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text: Thank you, America, for keeping the faith.

name: Joe Biden
text: This is one hell of a team.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Vice President Kamala Harris has been a key leader fighting for improved maternal health outcomes, elevating the issue nationally and convening experts and activists to find solutions.

She is leading the charge to tackle this crisis.

name: Joe Biden
Joe Biden
text:
We fought Big Pharma‚Äîand won.

For the first time in history, Medicare has negotiated lower prices for 10 prescription drugs selected for the first round of drug price negotiation. 

It‚Äôs real relief for millions of seniors and American taxpayers.

name: Joe Biden
text:
When I signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law, we beat Big Pharma, made the largest climate investment in history, and lowered energy and health care costs.

It fell entirely to Democrats to deliver it‚Äîwith @KamalaHarris casting the tie-breaking vote.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Two years ago today, I signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law.

It takes on Big Pharma and Big Oil to lower prescription drug prices and utility bills.  

It‚Äôs the biggest climate investment in history.  

And it‚Äôs creating hundreds of thousands of jobs‚Äîincluding many good-paying union jobs.

name: Joe Biden
text:
.@KamalaHarris and @Tim_Walz are going to be a great President and Vice President.

Check out their full conversation: kamalaharris.link/conversati‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
As @DrBiden says, cancer steals time and steals hope. Our family knows the feeling, as too many families do.

That‚Äôs why we launched the Cancer Moonshot and are announcing $150 million for cutting-edge cancer research: To end cancer as we know it.

name: Joe Biden
text:
It‚Äôs been one week since @Tim_Walz joined @KamalaHarris‚Äô campaign, which is inspiring folks across the country.

If we all work hard, in 84 days, we‚Äôll be celebrating their victory. Let‚Äôs make it happen: IWillVote.com.

name: Joe Biden
text:
This week marks seven years since white supremacists gathered in Charlottesville spouting sick, anti-semitic bile.

Trump said there were ‚Äúvery fine people on both sides.‚Äù 

Democracy is at stake. We will not let him win again.

name: Joe Biden
text: Damn proud to be an American.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Protecting access to fertility treatments is personal for @Tim_Walz and @GwenWalz, as it is for millions of families in America.

It‚Äôs brought them Hope‚Äîliterally.

Donald Trump put the miracle of IVF at risk for families desperately trying to have children when he helped overturn Roe v. Wade.

name: Joe Biden
text: Thanks to the PACT Act, over one million veterans are getting the care they deserve in every corner of the country.

name: Joe Biden
text: Vice President @KamalaHarris will be ready to serve on day one. Let‚Äôs make her president.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Two years ago today, I was so proud to sign the PACT Act into law.

It's the most significant expansion of care for veterans exposed to toxic substances and their families in our nation's history. 

It matters.

name: Joe Biden
text:
America invented semiconductors. 

Over time, the United States went from producing nearly 40% of the world‚Äôs chips to just over 10%‚Äîmaking our economy vulnerable to global supply chain disruptions.

The CHIPS and Science Act is changing that.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Vice President @KamalaHarris and Governor @Tim_Walz are running a campaign on behalf of all Americans.

And when they‚Äôre elected, they will govern on behalf of all Americans.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Today marks two years since I signed the bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act into law to revitalize American leadership in semiconductors, advance American competitiveness, and more.

These investments are creating opportunities across the country, and we‚Äôre just getting started.

name: Joe Biden
text:
Husband, father, veteran, teacher, coach, congressman, governor of Minnesota. 

And with your vote, we will make @Tim_Walz our next vice president.

I‚Äôm excited to cheer this team on.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The people of Maui will always remain in my heart and prayers.
 
Together, we've made real progress.
 
The voices of those who have called the island home for generations will continue to guide the work ahead as we remain focused on supporting their ongoing recovery.

name: Joe Biden
text:
The first major decision a party nominee makes is their choice for Vice President. And Kamala Harris has made a great decision in choosing Governor Tim Walz to be her running mate.

I've known Tim Walz for nearly two decades, first during his time in Congress and as Governor. A husband and father, he's been a school teacher and a high school football coach. He served for 24 years in the Army National Guard and became the highest ranking enlisted soldier to ever serve in Congress. As Governor, he's been a strong, principled, and effective leader.

The Harris-Walz ticket will be a powerful¬†voice for working people and America's great middle class. They will be the strongest defenders of our personal freedoms and our democracy. And they will ensure that America continues to lead the world and play its role as the indispensable nation.

It's time for all Democrats‚Äîand indeed all Americans‚Äîcommitted to freedom, democracy, and American leadership in the world to rally behind the Harris-Walz ticket.

Every generation of Americans faces a moment where they are asked to defend American democracy. That moment is now.

name: Joe Biden
text: Vice President @KamalaHarris is in Atlanta to underscore all that is at stake in this election. There‚Äôs too much on the line to sit this race out. Tune in now. nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1OyKAZmlZ‚Ä¶

name: Joe Biden
text:
In the face of increasing threats to America‚Äôs democratic institutions, I am calling for three bold reforms to restore trust and accountability to the Supreme Court and our democracy.

First, I am calling for a constitutional amendment called the No One Is Above the Law Amendment. It would make clear that there is no immunity for crimes a former president committed while in office. I share our Founders‚Äô belief that the president‚Äôs power is limited, not absolute. We are a nation of laws‚Äînot of kings or dictators.

Second, we have had term limits for presidents for nearly 75 years. We should have the same for Supreme Court justices. The United States is the only major constitutional democracy that gives lifetime seats to its high court. Term limits would help ensure that the court‚Äôs membership changes with some regularity. That would make timing for court nominations more predictable and less arbitrary. It would reduce the chance that any single presidency radically alters the makeup of the court for generations to come. I support a system in which the president would appoint a justice every two years to spend 18 years in active service on the Supreme Court.

Third, I‚Äôm calling for a binding code of conduct for the Supreme Court. This is common sense. The court‚Äôs current voluntary ethics code is weak and self-enforced. Justices should be required to disclose gifts, refrain from public political activity and recuse themselves from cases in which they or their spouses have financial or other conflicts of interest. Every other federal judge is bound by an enforceable code of conduct, and there is no reason for the Supreme Court to be exempt.

All three of these reforms are supported by a majority of Americans‚Äîas well as conservative and liberal constitutional scholars. In America, no one is above the law. In America, the people rule.

name: Joe Biden
text:
We can and must prevent the abuse of presidential power. 
We can and must restore the public‚Äôs faith in the Supreme Court. 
We can and must strengthen the guardrails of democracy.

I will keep defending our personal freedoms and our civil rights‚Äîfrom the right to vote to the right to choose.

I will keep calling out hate and extremism, and make it clear there is no place in America for political violence‚Äîor for any violence‚Äîever.

I will keep speaking out to protect our kids from gun violence, and our planet from the climate crisis.

That means I will continue to lower costs for hard-working families and grow our economy.

The sacred cause of our country is larger than any one of us.

And those of us who cherish that cause‚Äîthe cause of American democracy itself‚Äîmust unite to protect it.

Between hope and hate.

honesty, decency, and respect?

My father served in World War II as a Navy signalman. And in 2003, our son, Beau, joined the Delaware Army National Guard and served for a year in Iraq. 

We know what it‚Äôs like to wait to connect on a lagging phone call from across the world. To smile through another holiday with an empty chair at the table.

You are our family. And Joe will always fight for you.

name: Joe Biden
text: President Biden: The American principle that no one is above the law was reaffirmed. Donald Trump was given every opportunity to defend himself. It was a state case, not a federal case. And it was heard by a jury of 12 citizens. 12 Americans, 12 people like you. Like millions of Americans who served on juries, this jury is chosen the same way every jury in America is chosen. It was a process that Donald Trump's attorney was part of. The jury heard five weeks of evidence. After careful deliberation, the jury reached a unanimous verdict. They found Donald Trump guilty on all 34 felony counts. Now he‚Äôll be given the opportunity as he should to appeal that decision just like everyone else has that opportunity. That's how the American system of justice works. And it's reckless, it's dangerous, and it's irresponsible for anyone to say this was rigged just because they don't like the verdict. Our justice system has endured for nearly 250 years and it literally is the cornerstone of America. The justice system should be respected, and we should never allow anyone to tear it down. That's America. That's who we are. And that's who we will always be, God willing

I have co-sponsored every Article of Impeachment introduced in the House against unelected judges who believe they have the power to usurp Article II and override the authority of the duly elected President of the United States, chosen by a majority of the American people.

U.S. District Judge James Boasberg recently ordered that deportation flights carrying Venezuelan gang members‚Äîcriminals responsible for the deaths of American citizens‚Äîbe turned around mid-flight.

This ruling is not just an affront to the millions of Americans who support President Trump‚Äôs mission to secure our country, it is entirely nonjusticiable.

President Trump is our Commander-in-Chief and was exercising the powers fully vested in him by Article II of the Constitution. No judge at any level, including the Supreme Court, can limit the constitutional powers granted to the President.

Issuing such a weaponized, politically motivated judgment in bad faith undermines the credibility of our entire judicial system and demands immediate action from Article I to defend and uphold Article II.

Impeachment and removal from office is the constitutionally prescribed remedy, and it is urgently needed.

Unfortunately, Judge Boasberg is not alone. Other judges have similarly issued political rulings designed to undercut President Trump and his administration.

No single District Court judge in Washington, D.C., San Francisco, or anywhere else has more authority than the Presidency.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôve co-sponsored Articles of Impeachment against five federal judges so far. 

I‚Äôm also in support of legislative options to reign in rogue judges trying to play President. 

However, the easiest way to stop these rogue judges is for Congress to do our job and pass our own budget and policies through one big beautiful bill just like President Trump has asked us to. 

We are LAWMAKERS and we are the legislative body that can fund, defund, and make laws and then judges have to rule with the law.

No more CR‚Äôs.

No more kick the can down the road. 

Congress needs to take action and make President Trump‚Äôs agenda and executive orders the LAW.

name: M.T. Greene
text:
I've written this a couple times and deleted it, but here it goes...

I live in Western North Carolina.

I watched Joe Biden hand out billions of dollars to Ukraine.

Yet, nearly every single day here, we would get calls from families with young kids who lost their homes, begging for shelter.

During those months, I truly lost all hope. 

I watched BILLIONS of dollars go out the door to another country's war, while we were driving RVs to KIDS AND THEIR PARENTS living in tents, garages, a tool sheds.
 
You will never convince me that Ukraine deserved billions while American citizens in Western North Carolina had to beg each other for help.

Unless you lived through that experience... unless you personally dropped off an RV at the doorstep of American mountain momma and her kids who lost everything, like I did...

...you do NOT get to tell me what we "owe" Ukraine

I wasn't a MAGA person back then. I was honestly a stuck-up jerk who thought I was better than you because I got my news from "the experts". 

I couldn't have been more wrong. 

Once you see the media turn on you, your own government abandon you, the bubble begins to burst.

Then, you can't unsee it.

"America First" isn't just a slogan.

It's a blood-curling-scream into the night for all of us who were abandoned by our own government when we needed it the most...

That's why I'm MAGA now.
